rComments: I regret taking this class so much. He gives an unreasonable amount of reading considering I'm taking not only his class, but 2 other very demanding classes. I took this class because I needed something 'easy' compared to the other classes I was enrolled in, but this class ended up taking a huge portion of my time. DO NOT TAKE IT IF YOU DON'T NEED

Do not take this class,  that is unless of course you enjoy inflicting self torture. Not a helpful or approachable professor, does not respond to feedback, changes deadlines on a whim, assigns excessive busy work,  requires things in the course which were not made clear when signing up for the class. The list goes on and on.

By far one of the best classes I've ever taken - the subject matter is interesting, the lectures are interactive, and Wolf-meyer is very clear about his expectations. It does require a lot of independent work and you must do the readings but its worth it. Amazing professor and amazing class.

Not sure how to adequately express the nightmare that is this class. Not sure how Wolf-Meyer is allowed to still teach. A lecturing style drowning in hostility and elitism. A syllabus that is utterly mind boggling in its quantity. Policies that are flagrantly disrespectful to students. If his class is not required, run. If it is, prepare yourself.

Probably the most demanding professors I've encountered. That being said, I have never learned as much as I have in any other class. He challenges you with reading and comprehension. The lectures are an opportunity to discuss and explore the topics. He doesn't tell you what to think, but he shows you how to think. Definitely an invaluable lesson!

He makes his class unnecessarily confusing. Reading the 1200+ page reader is the only way I learned anything, because lectures were off topic and led by students, which isn't helpful when the material is this dense and theoretical. I got a good grade, but I had to read almost all 1200 pgs, do all the stupid busy work, attend all classes. Stress.

Impossible to grasp what he expected from his students. Funny guy,but went off on tangents that had nothing to do with the theories discussed from the 200+ readings per week.Impossible midterm and final.They both consisted of a take home essay and an in class portion of 10 questions.Reading questions,podcasts,a reader,&4 books!! RUN FOREST RUN!

Has the most infuriating grading policies. Takes away 5% for every class you miss over 2 classes...including section. I had an A, missed two classes, and ended this course with a low B. Frustrating especially when you work so hard and read that ridiculous 2000 page reader.

I think Wolf-Meyer's number one problem was that he relied too much on the students to provide feedback on what we wanted to learn. If a teacher expects me to read 200+ pages of reading a week, I expect him to dedicate considerable class time to having a prepared lecture and explaining dense theories. This class sucked and will put you through it.

For the amount of reading he'll make you do, he barely goes over it in class. Simplified dense theory readings to a 15 minute discussion, then spent 20 minutes on a tangent. If you want to learn and understand theory, avoid this class. If you want to learn about his personal life and child, go for it.
Just a terrible professor. Smug, barely teaches, assigns a disgusting amount of work. You will work your ass of just to get a passing grade.

Similar to Rihanna, Wolf-Meyer wants you to make him feel like he's the only girl in the world. 200+ pages of reading a week, reading questions and guides, podcasts, movies. To top it all off, the tests are really difficult. There was too much reading to go over in one class period, so we oftentimes didn't discuss any of the readings. A trainwreck.

Uses lengthy words in some strange attempt to sound more intelligent. If it's any indication of how terrible he is... He had power points explaining his other power points... Then reads these power points word for word. Found myself banging my head against the desk in an attempt to pass out and wake up after class had ended.
Hard teacher. Hard grader. But worth it. Just pay attention and take good notes. He knows his stuff, is kinda funny and entertaining but you WILL learn stuff...he just grades really hard...

Wolf-Meyer is an interesting character. Very sarcastic, intelligent, somewhat abrasive, and demanding. There is a lot of busy work including 200+ pages/ week plus reading questions, but the tests are essays-just repetition of this material. He presents a LOT of theories and makes you a better student. Only take this class if you want to learn.

Wolf-Meyer rocks! The reading questions guide your reading so you don't get lost in the articles/books and he clarifies the key concepts in class. I learned so much and he presented the information in a light that made me appreciate soc/cul anth (I was focusing on phys anth b4..now I'm sociocultural!). His exams are structured well & enjoyable.

I found Wolf-Meyers class both intriguing and life-altering in that in made me rethink about my perceptions surrounding medicine. He is a great teacher, who really cares about his students! I highly recommend taking one of his classes. Be fore-warned, he assigns a lot of reading, but it's interesting and well worth it. Plus, he's a fair grader!

I really don't understand the issues people have with Wolf-Meyer. He's fantastic! Sure he assigns a lot of reading (200pgs) but common we're in college!! He's got a wonderfully sarcastic sense of humor and is more than happy to explain theories and concepts. I would not recommend this class if you want an easy A but instead if you want to learn =)

One of the best classes I've taken. The subject matter is very difficult to understand at first, but presents the most provocative theories I've ever come across. Don't take this class if you just want an A, but to explore ideas that will challenge all of your preconceptions about science and medicine. Matthew has a great sense of humor too.

Teaching style is hard to understand. Lectures often don't relate to assigned readings in any obvious way. midterm and final take-home essays were easy but tedious; very obvious what his expectations are.

i'm an intense studier and i dutifully do all assigned readings but i was not able to comprehend this man's logic whatsoever. i found his choice of material interesting but his teaching execution was not up to par. i would not recommend him.
NO, don't take him. If it's the class that you want to take then look for someone who might be teaching it at another time or find a different class to fill the req. NO! Believe me!

Definitely an intelligent person and was able to bring up some interesting topics, like perspectives on the ways that social control permeate the medical field. However the class itself was largely incoherent.  Too much reading without enough attempts to tie the books and articles together.

Readings:lengthy and difficult. Quizzes: almost impossible to study for. Midterm and final weren't nearly as difficult as people made them out to be-his expectations were very clear. Accessible and willing to explain intricacies of complex subject. Do the readings, go to lecture and participate! This is not an easy class but very interesting.

I find his teaching style a joke. I learned essentially next to nothing in his lectures; he seems to go off on tangents half of the time and he rarely addresses the readings that we're assigned. Maybe the class was such crap because it was "his first time teaching it to undergrads."

Wolf-Meyer's lectures were not clearly related to readings. He has voiced strong opinions about students not learning what he thinks should have been learned prior to taking an introduction course and has personally dissed Santa Cruz students. I DO NOT recommend taking this prof. Poor teaching, unnecessary lengthy reading, and unclear examinations.

Doesn't take role in lecture.  Quizzes are based on readings... readings are lengthy!!!  Skim read as much as possible.  Midterm and final not as difficult or confusing as others have said.  Worth taking if you are into the subject, reading and doing your own thing.

This guy doesn't know what he's doing. His quizzes only contain Q's to see if you've read instead of to see if you're understanding the content. His midterm and final are confusing and odd. I pray for whoever takes him. Get out while you still can!

He expects you to read 300 pages (more or less) a week. During lecture, he uses ridiculously big words in order to explain the simplest things - using big words make him feel superior in some way? He makes the class teach themselves & makes the class create questions for their own tests. He's lazy or just doesn't care. DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!
